textbooks.title: Stochastic Calculus for Finance vol II
textbooks.author: Steven E. Shreve

topics: Probability review: Random variables and vectors

assignments.description: Around 5 homework assignments throughout the semester. Collaboration is encouraged.

policies.late_work: Late homework will lose 10 points for each day it is late. Assignments are due by the specified time.
policies.academic_integrity: Any plagiarism or other form of cheating will be dealt with under relevant Stevens policies.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology provides appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: Fully online with pre-recorded lectures and weekly problem set sessions.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills, live web conferencing using Zoom, compiling PDFs, VR headset provided by the school.
additional_info.support_resources: Contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) for support.

_metadata.course_description: This course is designed for advanced undergraduate students and masters students in Financial Engineering.
learning_outcomes: Classify stochastic processes as martingales, Markov, or both/neither
Determine the differentials of functions of stochastic processes
Change probability measures to facilitate pricing of derivatives
Solve stochastic differential equations through transformations to partial differential equations.
